subject: Re: [junit] HTTP Unit vs HTML Unit
msgSnippet: Beware of  support for JavaScripts. HTTPUnit are not very good, so I had to abandon and use other tools ... [Non-text portions of this message have been
messageBody:
Beware of support for JavaScripts.
HTTPUnit are not very good, so I had to abandon and use other tools



J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

>Mike Duffy wrote:
>
>
>
>>I assume that the people on this list are expert testers.
>>
>>Could you please give me some guidance on HTTP Unit vs HTML Unit.
>>
>>Thx in advance.
>>
>>
>
>Short version:
>
>HTMLUnit was born because Mike Bowler didn't like the low-level HTTPUnit
>API, circa early 2002. HTMLUnit models web page interaction, whereas
>HTTPUnit modeled (past tense) HTTP requests and responses. It is my
>understanding that HTTPUnit is more like HTMLUnit these days, although I
>haven't used it since 2002, so I can't be sure. (I'm going by what
>Russell Gold has told me.) If that's true, then it's largely a matter of
>taste.
>
>Try HTTPUnit first, then HTMLUnit. If HTMLUnit is really so much better,
>then you'll switch; and if not, then you won't. Me, I use HTMLUnit, but
>mostly because I almost always have.
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
